conclusion: Each book is split into n equal sub-stacks.
Mass of every sub-stack is w = 5 N / n.
Sub-stacks are arranged alternately forming a single vertical pile.
Only the contact surfaces between A-blocks and B-blocks supply kinetic friction.
Pulling force F equals the sum of the kinetic-friction forces at all interfaces.
Normal force on interface k is N_k = (2n – k) w.
Kinetic friction on interface k is f_k = μ w(2n – k).
Total pulling force F = μ w Σ_{k=1}^{2n-1} (2n – k).
Insert w = 5 N / n to get F = μ (5 N) (2n – 1).
This predicts a simple linear relation between F and (2n–1).
Trial 1: n = 2, F = 4.5 N gives μ = 0.30.
Check with other trials: n = 4, 8, 16, 64 all give μ ≈ 0.30.
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ ≈ 0.30.
